2571,"WN317","Mapping","On [talk-de](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/talk-de/2016-August/113357.html), Nikhil Prabhakar from Mapbox outlines a proposal to map turn restrictions and exit & destination tags remotely.  Some people reply to the thread; the rest of OSM reaches for the popcorn :)

The plan is to start in Stuttgart ([almost no](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/talk-de/2016-August/113367.html) Mapillary images), Wolfsburg and Berlin (the homes of Daimler, Porsche, VW, and [allegedly someone else](http://appleinsider.com/articles/16/04/18/apple-runs-secret-car-lab-in-berlin-with-15-20-employees-report-says)). 2570,"WN317","Mapping","Martijn van Exel [writes](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/mvexel/diary/39274) in his user blog about the newly restarted OpenStreetView (OSV) - now looked after by Telenav. Martijn points out that the OSV app can retrieve data from the bus systems of the car for better geo-referencing using the [OBD2](

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/On-board_diagnostics) interface. Unlike Mapillary, the front and back end are both free software.  [This issue](https://github.com/openstreetview/openstreetview.org/issues/6) is still open, however... we invite you to collaborate with pictures and [code](https://github.com/openstreetview)!",13

5250,"WN370","Other Geo Things","OsmAnd [published](http://osmand.net/features?id=mapillary) a guide about the new Mapillary plug-in, which is integrated in the newest version of their app.",13
5260,"WN371","Other Geo Things","aharvey [shows](http://www.openstreetmap.org/user/aharvey/diary/42139) its bicycle setup for 360 degree Mapillary photos.",13

5309,"WN372","Events","Edoardo Neerhut [writes](http://blog.mapillary.com/update/2017/08/29/State-of-the-Map-2017-An-evolving-map-ecosystem.html) in the Mapillary Blog about the OSM ecosystem, [OSMCha](https://osmcha.mapbox.com/) from Mapbox and about the AI assisted road tracing of Facebook in Thailand.",13

5353,"WN372","Other Geo Things","A nice article by Kartin Humai shows how to go on a ""[time travel](http://blog.mapillary.com/update/2017/08/30/how-to-make-time-travel-happen.html)"" with Mapillary. ;-)",13
5444,"WN374","Did you know that…","... you can [upload the photos](https://twitter.com/WikiLovesUK/status/906926328896684034) from your Mapillary trail to Wiki Commons?",13

5519,"WN375","Humanitarian OSM","Mapillary [tweets](https://twitter.com/fofliajinal/status/909871090494787584) about Microsoft sharing [4.9M images](http://blog.mapillary.com/update/2017/09/14/microsoft-imagery-for-disaster-recovery.html) to help with disaster recovery in Florida and Texas.",13

5513,"WN375","Software","Frederic Rodigo [announces](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/talk/2017-September/078792.html) on the mailing list Talk that Osmose-QA is experimenting by adding missing sign tags on OSM from Mapillary detected signs on pictures.",13

5594,"WN377","Events","In the town of [Chiavari](http://www.openstreetmap.org/#map=14/44.3176/9.3521) (Liguria, Italy), teams composed by one mapper and one volunteer from the Protezione Civile (Civil Protection, governmental body which deals with exceptional events management) ran a pilot data collecting project ([organised](https://twitter.com/CIMAFoundation/status/915923916023042048) by the municipality and the CIMA Foundation) focused on a flood scenario alongside the [Rupinaro](http://www.openstreetmap.org/way/19605149#map=14/44.3285/9.3240) creek. While the volunteers collected information of the buildings (levels, entrances and flood preparedness), the mappers improved OpenStreetMap adding the details in the area, and [photomapped](https://www.mapillary.com/app?focus=photo&pKey=4FFkIfk58z-A-vcAQtDunA) with Mapillary. [Local newspapers](http://www.ilsecoloxix.it/p/levante/2017/10/04/ASUfAAnJ-openstreetmap_alluvioni_mappatura.shtml) (automatic [translation](https://translate.google.com/translate?sl=auto&tl=EN&u=http://www.ilsecoloxix.it/p/levante/2017/10/04/ASUfAAnJ-openstreetmap_alluvioni_mappatura.shtml)) and [tv stations](https://youtu.be/5W6ECKLh8U8?t=4m23s) reported.",13

5874,"WN383","Other Geo Things","Stéphane Péneau [tweeted](https://twitter.com/stfmani/status/931852419365068801) the pictures of the encounter of two Mapillary contributors, one in a car, the other on a bike.",13

5968,"WN385","Mapping","Mapillary introduces [Mapillary Tasker](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2017/11/28/mapillary-tasker.html), this tool will let you invite people to help complete capture, map editing, or data verification tasks in your area.",13

6069,"WN388","Other Geo Things","Who will create the maps in the future? Man, machines or both together? A [blog article](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2017/12/21/who-will-build-the-maps-of-the-future.html) from Mapillary wants to find answers.",13

6360,"WN395","Mapping","Christopher Beddow from Mapillary [demonstrates](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2018/02/01/adventure-mapping-in-morocco.html) how he used street-level imagery as a visual aid to improve OpenStreetMap after hiking in the Atlas Mountains in Morocco.",13

6491,"WN398","Other Geo Things","Mapillary's #CompleteTheMap challenge has come to an end. The first [three places](https://mapillary.github.io/mapillary_greenhouse/global-challenge/) went to Brisbane, San Jose and Milano. To know more about the challenge, you can read in a [entry](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2018/02/21/challenging-winter-dip-completethemap.html) in the Mapillary blog.",13

6687,"WN402","Humanitarian OSM","Dan Joseph, GIS staff member of the American Red Cross, [describes](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2018/03/21/how-red-cross-uses-data-during-global-disasters.html) in the Mapillary blog how they use Mapillary in their organization.",13

6717,"WN402","Mapping","The Vermont Transportation Agency [shared](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2018/03/28/vermont-opens-up-5-years-of-road-imagery.html) 5 million images from the last five years on Mapillary.",13

6697,"WN402","Mapping","SketchOSM is a plugin for [SketchUp](https://www.sketchup.com/) that allows you to [add](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1PtYiTUIKiE) new buildings to OSM in 3D (editing existing OSM buildings isn't possible at present). A new feature called [PhotoMatch](https://twitter.com/iamnunocaldeira/status/979324741407444992), allows you to match the building height to street level imagery. Despite looking like an awesome tool, the usage of Google StreetView to add details using this new PhotoMatch is problematic. The author suggested to look into using Mapillary and OpenStreetCam for this purpose.",13

6773,"WN404","Other Geo Things","Mapillary [announces](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2018/04/12/scaling-up-with-a-15m-investment.html) a new, 15 million USD round of investment with BMW i Ventures, Samsung Catalyst Fund, and NavInfo joining in as investors.",13
6965,"WN408","Other Geo Things","Nothing new: HERE [uses](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2018/05/10/here-mapillary-global-partnership.html) Mapillary images - also in its online editor.",13

6987,"WN409","Mapping","User DeBigC [shares](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/DeBigC/diary/43975) his experiences with Mapillary in Ireland, where he has, to date, collected the most photos among all contributors.",13

7033,"WN410","Community","Alban Vivert, OSM France community member and CartONG NGO volunteer, started his cycling Andean cartographic itinerary at the beginning of May. Follow his [South American adventure](http://www.nomadmaps.net/) ![(es)](http://blog.openstreetmap.de/wp-uploads//2016/12/es.svg) ![(fr)](http://blog.openstreetmap.de/wp-uploads//2016/12/fr.svg) with an interactive map of the project, GPS traces (with elevation profile), and contributions to Mapillary.",13

7206,"WN415","Programming","User [miurahr](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/miurahr) sent a [pull request](https://github.com/JOSM/Mapillary/pull/79) adding 360 degree panorama photo viewer mode to JOSM 's Mapillary plugin.",13

7247,"WN416","Mapping","OpenStreetMap [announced](https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2018/07/03/bing-streetside-in-id/),via an official blog post, that Bing Streetside imagery is available in the online editor iD. Streetside is now the 3rd available street-level imagery in iD together with OpenStreetCam and Mapillary. The blog post says that Streetside will  ""probably become available""  in other editors like JOSM. Please note before using this imagery that the licence from Bing has certain restrictions.",13

7364,"WN418","Mapping","As SotM-US is being held in Detroit this year [Mikel Maron](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/mikelmaron) is helping to make OpenStreetMap in the area better, starting with bike share docking stations. He wrote a [diary post](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/mikelmaron/diary/44405) describing how he was confirming and improving the locations of bike share stations, that were already added in OSM, using open data along with aerial, Bing Streetside, Mapillary and OpenStreetCam imagery. In his comprehensive blog post he explains his workflow and what he has learned during this exercise.",13

7377,"WN418","Other Geo Things","Stéphane Péneau [tweets](https://twitter.com/stfmani/status/1020693161356734464) his disappointment that Mapillary is still compressing images. He added examples of how the compression lowered the quality of the images.",13

7542,"WN421","Programming","Florian Schäfer worked on improving JOSM's [Wikipedia plugin](https://josm.openstreetmap.de/wiki/Help/Plugin/Wikipedia) during his Google Summer of Code project. According to the [documentation](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/JOSM/Plugins/Wikipedia/GSoC_2018) he added validator warnings if wikipedia and wikidata don't refer to the same item and made wikidata items with coordinates a lot more accessible than they were before. Florian also helped out other GSoC students and has maintained the Mapillary plugin over the past 4 years.",13

7686,"WN424","Community","United States ambassador to Turkmenistan, Allan Mustard (OSM [apm-wa](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/apm-wa)) wrote two articles about his work on OSM, currently the best map of Turkmenistan available to the general public. As you can read in [one article](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/apm-wa/diary/44898), being an ambassador has the advantage that you can use the head of the Motor Roads State Concern as a QA tool. In his [second article](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/apm-wa/diary/44891) he gave some insight into his tour to a southern Balkan Province in Turkmenistan where he updated road information and collected POIs, GPS traces, and Mapillary pictures.",13

7749,"WN425","Mapping","The Osmose QA tool [now includes](https://twitter.com/osmose_qa/status/1038751075979980801) a layer with traffic signs from Mapillary where the equivalent information is missing from OSM. At the moment, the layer is available in France, Brussels and parts of Germany.",13

7765,"WN425","Releases","Wambacher's OSM related software list [has been updated](https://wambachers-osm.website/index.php/osm-software-watchlist). Most recent version changes were Komoot Android, Mapbox Nav SDK , Mapillary Android, Naviki Android, QMapShack and Vespucci.",13

7962,"WN430","Community","On October 11 Nomad Maps finished his cartographic cycle tour through the Andes route having cycled 5000 kilometres. As a result more than 10,000 new objects were mapped and more than 100,000 additional photos added to Mapillary. He had 17 meetings with OpenStreetMap contributors in Colombia, Ecuador and Peru. As a cherry on the pie, Alban Vivert ([@Nomadmapper](https://hdyc.neis-one.org/?Nomadmapper)) participated in SOTM Latam 2018 in Buenos Aires to [present](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s6KwHZoSbNk&index=16&list=PLPZlngwRgZL0a0YvfkfLmYEQdex6ktzUb) the results of the expedition and to meet other members of the OSM community. More info on [Nomad's blog](https://nomadmapsblog.wordpress.com/) and the [website of Nomad Maps](http://www.nomadmaps.net/).",13

8178,"WN434","Mapping","We recently reported that Telenav has open-sourced the machine learning based street sign detection and the resulting training data that recognises nearly 100 sign types. Telenav makes use of it with its [OpenStreetCam platform](http://openstreetcam.org), a service very similar to Mapillary. The OpenStreetCam JOSM plugin visualises detections in the latest version. Martijn van Exel [describes](http://blog.improveosm.org/en/2018/11/help-train-openstreetcams-open-sign-detection-platform/) a _Power Validator Workflow_, that enables you to validate entire trips with many detected signs very quickly on the OpenStreetCam website.",13
8139,"WN434","Other Geo Things","Mapillary [launches](https://www.geospatialworld.net/news/mapillary-launches-an-open-source-software-development-kit/) an open-source software development kit",13

8224,"WN435","Releases","Martijn van Exel upgraded MapRoulette to version 3.1.1 on maproulette.org. In his user blog Martijn [explains](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/mvexel/diary/46961) the new features, which include the availability of Mapillary images on MapRoulette,  rebuilding tasks and a public Leaderboard for each challenge",13

8554,"WN443","Software","Mapillary has just released a desktop application for uploading large amounts of street-level imagery, which can then be used for editing OpenStreetMap. It is currently available for Mac and Windows. [Learn more](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2018/12/27/desktop-uploader.html) on the Mapillary blog.",13

8628,"WN444","Mapping","In his OSM diary Andres Gomez Casanova [exhibits](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/AngocA/diary/47504) ![(es)](https://blog.openstreetmap.de/wp-uploads/2016/12/es.svg) his bicycle gear. He is using the equipment for 360-degree photography for Mapillary in Bogotá, Colombia.",13

8671,"WN445","Other Geo Things","The website MIT Technology Review [features](https://www.technologyreview.com/s/612825/open-source-maps-should-help-driverless-cars-navigate-our-cities-more-safely/) an article on how crowdsourced maps can help driverless cars by solving major current issues such as the slow update cycle of road data and the sparse mapping of roadside infrastructure. According to the article, Mapillary, which creates maps and catalogues roadside objects based on uploaded streetside images, is assumed to have potential to fill the gap of missing data for autonomous driving. Mapillary, which is free for non-commercial and personal use, charges licence fees from its commercial customers.",13

8691,"WN446","Humanitarian OSM","As part of the [EuYoutH_OSM](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/EuYoutH_OSM) Erasmus+ Project [Ciaran Staunton](http://hdyc.neis-one.org/?DeBigC) provided [training](https://twitter.com/euYoutH_OSM/status/1091720495991537664) to students from [Portmarnock Community School](https://twitter.com/PortmarnockCS) on using an LG360ActionCAM and Mapillary in preparation for their humanitarian mapping trip to Lesotho in February.",13

8694,"WN446","Mapping","Mapillary [have added](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2019/01/23/updating-maps-with-cameras-42-new-point-features.html) another 42 different features which are detected automatically from contributors' photos.",13

8802,"WN447","Mapping","In his user diary, alexkemp [describes](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/alexkemp/diary/47684) the issue with Mapillary overblurring the uploaded photos. According to his post, he considers 92 percent of all blurs on the 111 photos he investigated as ""stupid blurs"".",13

8834,"WN448","Community","Chris Beddow and Daniela Waltersdorfer J [wrote](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2019/02/12/potential-for-openstreetmap-to-seize-the-curb.html), in the Mapillary Blog, about the need for more detailed mapping of kerbs.",13

8831,"WN448","Did you know that…","Following her [tweet](https://twitter.com/mapillary/status/1095997095352373248) that kerbs are become increasingly important nowadays, Daniela Waltersdorfer [published](http://geoawesomeness.com/curbs-openstreetmap-sideline-center/) an article about kerbs, why she thinks their importance is growing, opens questions with regards to mapping them in OSM and how ""curbs""--or, as they should be correctly named ""kerbs""--should be added in OSM. She draws special attention to transition points, i.e. where kerbs are lowered, as these are important features to pedestrians, cyclists, and especially to those with reduced mobility. On Twitter, Tobias Jordans [points to](https://twitter.com/tordans/status/1096687236593139712) the parking lane viewer/editor on [zlant.github.io](https://zlant.github.io/parking-lanes/#17/52.52355/13.42810) as an easy way to add parking information to OSM.",13

8881,"WN449","Mapping","Mapillary [features](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2019/02/19/intro-to-deriviste-and-openstreetmap.html) an article about the lesser-known OSM tool, [Deriviste](https://osm.cycle.travel/deriviste/). Deriviste, introduced by Richard Fairhurst in October 2018, allows users to create OSM data while looking at Mapillary images. For example, a click on an image is translated into a data point. The comprehensive blog post contains background information and details how Deriviste should be used, including practical examples.",13

9142,"WN454","Releases","User Wambacher is constantly updating his [OSM Software Watchlist](https://wambachers-osm.website/index.php/osm-software-watchlist), which includes almost all OSM-related software along with the date of their latest release. Most recently Basecamp, Mapillary,  Vespucci and many others received an update. Wambacher is highlighting one new addition: [OSHDB](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/OSHDB), a high-performance data analysis platform for OSM's full-history data.",13

9192,"WN455","Community","Colin Blackburn [is intrigued](https://twitter.com/ximenesuk/status/1114832206696984576) by a ""Clothing Optional"" labelled beach in OSM on a route that he has vaguely planned to run. We hope he is not helping Mapillary during his runs.",13

9208,"WN455","Did you know that…","...the webpage [Pic4Review](https://pic4review.pavie.info/#/)? It allows mapping, using Mapillary images, and participating in various missions, such as adding accessibility for wheelchairs, adding ecopoints, or integrating missions over public toilets. You can also add your own quests!",13

9314,"WN457","Maps","As Mapillary [reports](https://blog.mapillary.com/news/2019/04/17/five-us-dots-upload-photologs-to-mapillary.html) in its blog, the Departments of Transportation of the US states Utah, Florida, Arizona, Connecticut and Vermont have uploaded images covering 430,000 km of roads to Mapillary where they were automatically processed to detect traffic signs and other features.",13

9372,"WN458","Community","[Jinal Foflia](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/jinalfoflia) from Grab recently [shared](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/jinalfoflia/diary/74639) a post about Grab's team in Thailand who has been uploading Mapillary imagery for areas around Chiang Mai. It is already ~82% complete; covering 1,667 km of roads. They are aiming for the upload to be completed by end of this month!",13

9421,"WN459","OSM in the media","Infofunes.com.ar [reports](https://infofunes.com.ar/noticias/con-su-bici-como-unica-herramienta-armo-un-street-view-de-funes) (automatic [translation](https://translate.google.com/translate?sl=es&tl=en&u=https://infofunes.com.ar/noticias/con-su-bici-como-unica-herramienta-armo-un-street-view-de-funes)) about the work done by Franco Benedetti ([@mweper](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/mweper)) in the small town of [Funes](http://gk.historic.place/historische_objekte/translate/en/index-en.html?zoom=16&lat=-32.91756&lon=-60.80978&select=w322539056&pid=HaHbHcSaHe), Argentina. He improves OSM by cycling through the city, taking pictures with Mapillary and enriching his contributions with Wikipedia information.",13

9476,"WN460","Humanitarian OSM","Mapillary and HOT [are collaborating](https://www.hotosm.org/updates/number-map2020-campaign/) to speed up map data collection in undermapped regions with the launch of the #map2020 campaign. #map2020 asks local mappers to submit street level imagery using projects that collect data for humanitarian purposes. The two winning projects will be invited to the  [HOT Summit](https://summit2019.hotosm.org/) in Heidelberg, Germany in September this year.",13

9452,"WN460","Mapping","Christopher Beddow, from Mapillary, has been travelling and recently he was lucky to have good weather whilst [capturing](https://twitter.com/cbed32/status/1124238906986307585) some splendid scenery in Scotland.",13

9521,"WN461","Other Geo Things","Mapillary's #CompleteTheMap is back. The challenge kicks off in June—[read more in the Mapillary blog](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2019/05/14/complete-the-map-v.html).",13

9548,"WN462","Mapping","Christopher Beddow, from Mapillary, has written a blog post about two different ways contributors can use [Mapillary data to edit OpenStreetMap](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2019/05/23/map-features-in-openstreetmap.html).",13

9552,"WN462","Other Geo Things","Mapillary [opened](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2019/05/22/map-data-on-demand-mapillary-marketplace.html) a marketplace for street-level imagery and the manual validation of geospatial data extracted from images using Mapillary's Machine Learning technology. You can buy or sell street-level imagery and request the validation of data. Validating machine learning results is rewarded with game points. Whether the data can be used for OSM or if it is a commercial-only product was not made clear.",13

9603,"WN464","Maps","Said Turksever [tweeted](https://twitter.com/asturksever/status/1135936043251830784) about ICT4Society in Turkey, a project using OSM and Mapillary to help improve social inclusion for people with disabilities, and links to the resulting [map](https://izmirosmcommunity.github.io/izmiraccessiblitymap.html).",13

9625,"WN464","Releases","In the new release of OsmAnd 2.80 (iOS), Mapillary photos are displayed for navigation, as is already the case on Android. In addition to performance improvements there were many other adjustments. You can [read](https://osmand.net/blog) more about this in OsmAnd's blog.",13

9773,"WN467","Community","Chris Beddow from Mapillary [blogged](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2019/06/26/end-of-maps-as-we-know-it.html) about the evolution of OSM, mapping technologies and OSM's communities. His conclusion is that every mapper, every single community in OSM matters and the ties between all stakeholders, be it commercial companies or volunteers, should be made stronger.",13

9962,"WN471","Releases","Martijn van Exel [wrote](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/mvexel/diary/390353) a blog post about the new version of MapRoulette. Version 3.3.3 introduces virtual projects to organise challenges that belong together, improves the integration of Mapillary and adds the ability to tag a task with a MapRoulette-specific tag.",13

10083,"WN474","Mapping","The mapping company lvl5 has been acquired and is ""moving on to new adventures"", but all of the street-level imagery they paid to collect is currently being [uploaded to Mapillary](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2019/08/12/welcoming-lvl5-to-mapillary.html) and will soon be available for editing OSM.",13

10532,"WN484","Releases","The iD editor has been [updated](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/rails-dev/2019-October/017038.html) to v2.16.0. The release notes [highlight](https://github.com/openstreetmap/openstreetmap-website/pull/2413) support for objects which were detected in Mapillary images and you can track changes while editing. You can now use this version on the main map.",13

column1: 10667,"WN487","Other Geo Things","About a year ago Yandex, a kind of Russian Google, [launched](https://yandex.ru/blog/company/fotoputeshestviya-na-yandeks-kartakh) ![(ru)](https://blog.openstreetmap.de/wp-uploads/2016/12/ru.svg) (automatic [translation](https://translate.google.com/translate?sl=auto&tl=EN&u=https://yandex.ru/blog/company/fotoputeshestviya-na-yandeks-kartakh)) a service similar to Mapillary - a collection of panoramic images from users, mainly taken with dashcams. Now these images are available on Yandex.Maps in the ""Zerkala"" (Mirrors) section.",13

10749,"WN489","Other Geo Things","Mapillary [launched](https://gisuser.com/2019/10/mapillary-launches-a-mapping-dashcam-solution-to-help-logistics-companies-cut-delivery-delays-by-improving-maps-en-route/) a dashcam that’s been customised for mapping purposes. The dashcam collects and uploads images automatically and is aimed at equipping delivery fleets, so map data can be generated in real time.",13
10779,"WN490","Community","kartonage [posted](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/kartonage/diary/391495) a quick reflection on his Mapillary contributions this year.",13

10855,"WN491","Other Geo Things","According to a [blog entry](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2019/12/16/the-road-to-one-billion-images.html), there are now one billion images on the Mapillary platform, all open and freely available for mapping in OpenStreetMap. The 500,000,000 mark was passed eight months ago.",13

10918,"WN492","Events","Lindsey Higgins [reports](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2019/12/04/understanding-risk-and-state-of-the-map-africa-2019.html) on the Mapillary Blog about SotM Africa and about the regional conference ""[Understanding Risk West and Central Africa](https://understandrisk.org/event/understanding-risk-west-and-central-africa/#english)"" in Abidjan.",13

10988,"WN494","Other Geo Things","The Swiss mountain village of Brienz/Brinazauls (Graubünden) [slides downhill](https://www.travelbook.de/orte/gefaehrliche-orte/schweizer-bergdorf-brienz-rutscht-ab) ![(de)](https://blog.openstreetmap.de/wp-uploads/2016/12/de.svg)  (automatic [translation](https://translate.google.com/translate?sl=auto&tl=EN&u=https://www.travelbook.de/orte/gefaehrliche-orte/schweizer-bergdorf-brienz-rutscht-ab))) at a speed of one metre per year due to a geological ""smear mass"". To add to their worries the village also sits under an unstable cliff. The [village](https://www.openstreetmap.org/node/240091732#map=15/46.6672/9.5987) may need to be moved from its current position as a catastrophe could befall the village if it remains where it is. An extensive geological monitoring system [will be installed](https://www.srf.ch/news/regional/graubuenden/bewegtes-brienz-das-rutschende-dorf-erhaelt-hilfe)  ![(de)](https://blog.openstreetmap.de/wp-uploads/2016/12/de.svg) (automatic [translation](https://translate.google.com/translate?sl=auto&tl=EN&u=https://www.srf.ch/news/regional/graubuenden/bewegtes-brienz-das-rutschende-dorf-erhaelt-hilfe)) to warn the villagers in time. SelfishSeahorse has taken picturesque [mapillary images](https://www.mapillary.com/map/im/zMmOPGeI-KtCYDek-PAUXA) of this area.",13
11024,"WN495","Maps","Mapillary [is hiring](https://jobs.mapillary.com/) for a range of positions including designers and marketers.",13

11050,"WN496","Mapping","Mapillary have [made](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2020/01/16/how-to-use-mapillary-point-data-in-openstreetmap-id.html) their map features available as a data layer in iD Editor. The layer contains point data which was extracted from imagery uploaded to Mapillary.",13

11172,"WN498","Maps","Mapillary [started](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2020/01/29/CompleteTheMap-VI-announcement.html) the CompleteTheMap challenge for the northern hemisphere to improve its imagery. The top 3 contributors in terms of number of unique kilometres between 14 February and 15 March 2020 will be awarded with prizes.",13

11191,"WN499","Programming","Chris Beddow, from Mapillary, [blogged](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2020/02/06/mapillary-data-in-jupyter.html) about the possibilities of working with Mapillary data in Jupyter Notebooks.The hands-on guide explains how to access the Mapillary APIs and work with images, image sequences, and (if you've paid the subscription for map data) with features such as traffic signs, crosswalks, utility poles and pavement markings.",13

11291,"WN500","Mapping","Mapillary [released](https://www.mapillary.com/mapping-in-logistics) the results of their survey of delivery drivers, carried out to estimate the cost to business of broken maps. The losses due to broken maps are huge.",13

11304,"WN501","Other Geo Things","The imagery provider Mapillary [is now available](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2020/02/21/mapillary-in-arcgis-urban.html) in ArcGIS Urban, ESRI's tool for smart city planning, providing imagery with street-level perspective.",13

11387,"WN503","Community","Mapillary and Humanitarian OpenStreetMap Team are launching a new mapping campaign, #map2020, to improve maps and navigation in low- and middle-income countries. Jessica Bergmann [invited](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/hot/2020-March/015151.html) communities to get involved for the chance for one individual to win a fully-funded trip to present at the HOT Summit in Cape Town, South Africa. This year's [campaign](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2020/03/10/map2020-20.html) calls for communities to capture street-level imagery with Mapillary that contributes to improved navigation within their communities. Expressions of interest must be submitted by 20 March and final projects by 20 April.",13

11510,"WN505","Mapping","Mapillary [outlines](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2020/03/19/Mapping_in_the_Times_of_Covid-19_and_How_You_Can_H.html) the possibilities you have to improve OSM while staying, voluntarily or involuntarily, at home during the current pandemic.",13

11552,"WN506","Mapping","Chris Beddow of Mapillary has moved his webinar on mapping against COVID-19 from 2 April to 7 April at 18:00 CET. He will use tools ranging from Osmose to Pic4Review and MapRoulette to enrich OpenStreetMap. You can sign up for the webinar [here](https://mapagainstcovid19.confetti.events/).",13

11607,"WN508","Community","Mapillary's Edoardo Neerhut [blogged](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2020/04/08/better-capacity-planning.html) about the importance of maps for capacity planning in the fight against COVID-19. He detailed the benefits of having better maps and pointed to MapRoulette tasks for adding data to hospitals in the US.",13

11626,"WN508","Mapping","Chris Beddow, of Mapillary, [shared](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lbKfPamNyUs&list=PL685iyzu8a8mc0mjOGqmDQpXhs-bs_EtA) a webinar on YouTube on how to add hospital data to the map to help curb the spread of COVID-19.",13

11767,"WN511","Mapping","The latest Mapillary for JOSM release brings new features for the JOSM plugin: more flexible filters, enhanced changeset tagging, support for organisations, and more. In a blogpost Chris Beddow, from Mapillary, [provides](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2020/04/07/josm-updates.html) some background information.",13
11763,"WN511","Mapping","Chris Beddow, a Mapillary solutions engineer, [hosted](https://youtu.be/lbKfPamNyUs) a webinar on how to improve the map in the fight against COVID-19.",13

11834,"WN513","Mapping","muramoto [tweeted](https://twitter.com/muramototomoya/status/1260191797583556609?s=19) screenshots of two tools. [Street-level POI Viewer](https://tankaru.github.io/Street-level-POI-Viewer/viewer.html#16/52.1565/5.3894) displays POIs from OSM and Wikipedia over Mapillary images. He also [pointed](https://twitter.com/muramototomoya/status/1260904704126578688?s=19) to another [tool](https://tankaru.github.io/Measure-Height-with-Mapillary/) that allows the calculation of angles and distances, also based on Mapillary and an OSM basemap. You can use the two values to determine heights with the online calculator provided. The project files [are available](https://github.com/tankaru?tab=repositories) on GitHub.",13

11854,"WN513","Mapping","Mapillary images have been [used](https://twitter.com/mapillary/status/1261199081767989248) by the Ukrainian community to map over a thousand [speed bumps](https://twitter.com/mapillary/status/1261199081767989248) in Kiev.",13

12017,"WN517","Community","The city of Rostock is testing Mapillary on a small scale and [asks for help](https://forum.openstreetmap.org/viewtopic.php?id=69708) ![(de)](https://blog.openstreetmap.de/wp-uploads/2016/12/de.svg) (automatic [translation](https://translate.google.com/translate?sl=auto&tl=EN&u=https://forum.openstreetmap.org/viewtopic.php?id=69708)) to create enough training data for object recognition. Street drains and gullies, benches, waste baskets and rubbish bins are the objects needing verification, but not various small manhole covers (e.g. fire hydrants).",13

12049,"WN517","Humanitarian OSM","HOT and [iLAB Liberia](https://www.ilabliberia.org/about) have jointly [investigated](https://www.hotosm.org/updates/hot-and-ilab-liberia-exploring-the-potential-of-machine-learning-to-augment-human-mappers-in-monrovia/) the feasibility of using data generated from both aerial and street-level images by machine learning to augment on-the-ground mapping by people. The study areas were in Monrovia: 5cm aerial imagery ([OpenAerialMap](https://map.openaerialmap.org/#/-10.789110660552977,6.341914521766597,15/square/03333022/5e53faa7906c590005ecc5bb?_k=q74rjo)) was captured by drones and covers 20 square kilometres; around 160 kilometres of street level imagery ([Mapillary](https://www.mapillary.com/app/?lat=6.374227905418664&lng=-10.790092970622482&z=15&focus=map&pKey=ffNeOVboGGqMWiBoCGzY7f)) was also obtained using a dashcam.",13
12079,"WN518","Community","Various comments have been made about the acquisition of Mapillary by Facebook:

In an article on medium.com Joe Morrison [asks](https://medium.com/@joemorrison/why-on-earth-did-facebook-just-acquire-mapillary-9838405272f8) why Facebook took over Mapillary. In his article he also sheds light on Mapillary's products, which are not well known in the OSM community. Joe presents three reasons for the acquisition in the article.
Harry Wood [compares](https://twitter.com/harry_wood/status/1273775601648836609) the acquisition with Microsoft's purchase of GitHub.

Ilya Zverev [discusses](http://shtosm.ru/all/mapillary-in-2020-will-now-have-stories/) ![(ru)](https://blog.openstreetmap.de/wp-uploads/2016/12/ru.svg) (automatic [translation](https://translate.google.com/translate?sl=auto&tl=EN&u=http://shtosm.ru/all/mapillary-in-2020-will-now-have-stories/)) the consequences of the purchase for Mapillary's future and sustainability. He guesses that Facebook might repeat the same 'mistakes' in Western countries as it did with AI-based tracing of satellite imagery in developing countries.",13

12109,"WN519","Community","Julien Minet [writes](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/juminet/diary/393393) in his user diary that he, despite having advertised for Mapillary in the past, will no longer contribute to Mapillary, now that it was sold to Facebook. He does not want to support a company earning money from neo-nazis.",13

12116,"WN519","Humanitarian OSM","SIGenBici has been selected as the #map2020 project of the year. HOT [revealed](https://www.hotosm.org/updates/number-map2020-results-announced/) that the project from Medellín, Colombia had been chosen from the 28 groups that participated in #map2020. This project was led by Natalia Arruda and focused on mapping cycling infrastructure within the city. Rebecca Firth and Edoardo Neerhut [give](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2020/06/16/map2020-results.html) more details on the criteria used to select the project of the year and the other seven projects that were finalists.",13

12220,"WN521","Programming","SviMik has created a [tool](https://osm.svimik.com/photosync/) to synchronise your Mapillary and OpenStreetCam accounts. There is a discussion [thread](https://forum.mapillary.com/t/mapillary-openstreetcam-synchronization-tool/4246/3) on the Mapillary forum.",13

12377,"WN524","Software","[Misiones Provincial Routes](http://sig.misiones.gob.ar/mapas/dpv/) (automatic [translation](https://translate.google.com/translate?sl=auto&tl=EN&u=http://sig.misiones.gob.ar/mapas/dpv/)) is a tool built with institutional and collaborative contributions, such as OpenStreetMap, Mapillary, Wikipedia, and Openrouteservice. Developed by the Dirección de Modernización de la Gestión y Gobierno Electrónico de la Provincia de Misiones, Argentina, it is an interactive map to virtually travel provincial routes and roads. Carlos Brys, one of the developers, [gives](https://www.primeraedicion.com.ar/nota/100311027/desarrollan-mapa-virtual-interactivo-para-recorrer-las-rutas-y-caminos-provinciales/) (automatic [translation](https://translate.google.com/translate?sl=auto&tl=EN&u=https://www.primeraedicion.com.ar/nota/100311027/desarrollan-mapa-virtual-interactivo-para-recorrer-las-rutas-y-caminos-provinciales/)) more details in a _Primera Edicion_ article.",13

12541,"WN527","Community","Nirab Pudasaini created a lot of graphics analysing his own OSM twitter dataset containing over 45,000 tweets containing [""OpenStreetMap""](https://twitter.com/NirabPudasaini/status/1287049767328059394). Cluster analysis reveals some sub-communities such as [osm.fr](https://twitter.com/NirabPudasaini/status/1295494152105467907), OSM enterprises with [Mapbox and Mapillary](https://twitter.com/NirabPudasaini/status/1295490363902353409), the OSM community from the [Americas](https://twitter.com/NirabPudasaini/status/1295502458106654720), the sub [community from Africa](https://twitter.com/NirabPudasaini/status/1295490363902353409),  clusters focused on[ teaching and learning about OSM](https://twitter.com/NirabPudasaini/status/1295512481658527745), clusters around [map based data viz](https://twitter.com/NirabPudasaini/status/1295523900244275200) centred around @qgis, [and](https://twitter.com/NirabPudasaini/status/1295525527051280384) [many](https://twitter.com/NirabPudasaini/status/1295521707030175745) [more](https://twitter.com/NirabPudasaini/status/1295508494049828868).",13

12539,"WN527","Open Data","Mapillary [has announced](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2020/08/24/global-map-features-openstreetmap.html) that computer vision extracted data is now available globally on OSM. Previously only traffic signs were available in JOSM, and other data was available by request in iD. Now data including pedestrian crossings (crosswalks), traffic lights, bicycle parking, and many other classes are available globally, thanks to image contributions from Mapillary users.",13

12593,"WN528","Other Geo Things","Mapillary [announced](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2020/08/28/map-data-mapillary-api.html) that anyone can now access their map features directly via an API; filtering and downloading images, detected objects, and map features programmatically.",13

12622,"WN529","Programming","At the Google Summer of Code, Kishan Tripathi, K Rahul Reddy, Rebecca Schmidt and Daniel Weaver [worked](https://summerofcode.withgoogle.com/organizations/5154733884440576/#projects) on OpenStreetMap.
K Rahul Reddy [documented](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/krahulreddy/diary/394064) his project about search suggestions on osm.org in detail on his blog.

[Here](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/JOSM/Plugins/Mapillary/GSoC_2020) you can find the code for indoor tagging by [Rebecca Schmidt](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Google_Summer_of_Code/2020/BIM_Import), [Kishan Tripathi](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/JOSM/Plugins/Mapillary/GSoC_2020) and [Daniel Weaver](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/DWeaver/diary/394059), whose blog post we [reported](https://weeklyosm.eu/en/archives/13678#wn528_23278) on last week.",13

12644,"WN530","Community","Allan Mustard, aka apm-wa, [published](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/apm-wa/diary/394167) a diary entry about his new camera setup for Mapillary imagery and the recent decisions of the OSMF Board about funding the development of OSM editors (namely iD, Potlatch and StreetComplete) and the hire of a full-time system reliability engineer.",13

12901,"WN535","Community","The Mapillary team is [seeking](https://twitter.com/cbed32/status/1319397926926307329?s=20) editors using JOSM to interview about their workflows, whether or not they include use of the Mapillary plugin for JOSM. Interested users should reach out to osm@mapillary.com.",13

12949,"WN536","Humanitarian OSM","The [Mapping Power campaign](https://bit.ly/MappingPower) was [featured in Mapillary's Blog](https://bit.ly/MapillaryBlog), explaining how students across the [YouthMappers](https://www.youthmappers.org/) network are using augmented and volunteer mapping through [Mapillary](https://www.mapillary.com/), [Map With AI](https://mapwith.ai/#14/2.24856/32.87386), [TeachOSM](https://teachosm.org/), and [HOT](https://www.hotosm.org/) to improve Sierra Leone's electrical grid and connect rural communities.",13

12985,"WN537","Events","As part of National Heritage Week in Ireland, the local OSM community has [decided](https://www.openstreetmap.ie/socially-distant-mapping-for-clonmel-heritage-week) to focus on the historic town of [Clonmel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clonmel). The first step was to quickly map from satellite imagery; in order to supplement this a Mapillary stream was also taken, COVID-19 compliant with mask from inside a car, using a camera attached to the window so that it could capture both sides of the road.",13

13185,"WN542","Other Geo Things","Just like Mapillary, Google now [allows](https://www.theverge.com/2020/12/3/22149884/google-maps-street-view-photos-phone-android-update) user generated Street View photos, taken with a mobile app, to be added in areas where it has low coverage. While users have been able to submit Street View imagery in the past, it required a special 360-degree camera. This new feature just makes use of an Android phone camera.",13

13348,"WN545","Mapping","Tobias Jordans [reported](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/tordans/diary/395215), in his diary, about a camera tripod prototype he has developed for capturing Mapillary pictures by bicycle.",13

13344,"WN545","Mapping","Taylor Smock, the maintainer of the JOSM Mapillary plugin, has [added](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2020/12/22/introducing-smart-edits-JOSM.html) new functionality called 'Smart Edits', which allows mappers to add missing features detected by Mapillary's object detection to OSM. Clicking on the markers opens a pre-filled edit dialogue with the relevant properties.",13

13368,"WN546","Maps","Christopher Beddow wrote a [blog post](https://bedogged.substack.com/p/the-mobile-map-app-part-i-the-void) about why 'OSM fails to  compete with Google Maps'. Although they work for Facebook subsidiary Mapillary these posts are from an entirely personal point of view and include numerous examples of how digital maps fit into work and leisure activities. This initial post has already seen a lot of commentary on the [OSM subreddit](https://www.reddit.com/r/openstreetmap/comments/kp3dsr/why_openstreetmap_as_a_product_fails_to_compete/) and [Hacker News](https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id",13

13486,"WN548","Other Geo Things","Mapillary [is making](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2021/01/18/vistas-2-dataset.html) available Vistas 2.0, a major semantic annotation upgrade to their street-level image dataset (for AI training and validation) of 25,000 images from around the world.",13

13859,WN557","Mapping","DenisJu [called](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/DenisJu/diary/396147) on everyone who is on the road in Albania to take and share mobile phone images in Mapillary. He is specifically interested in images of the Albanian region Shkoder County, where he is keen to update OSM based on the donated images.",13

column1: 14050,"WN561","Mapping","Edoardo Neerhut has [written](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2021/04/16/pedestrian-blog-post.html)  a post on the Mapillary blog looking at the quality of pedestrian data in OpenStreetMap. Five cities with distinct characteristics were analysed to see how closely OpenStreetMap matches the reality on the ground.",13

14074,"WN562","Community","Four communities in Eastern and Southern Africa have been [selected](https://www.hotosm.org/updates/the-eastern-and-southern-africa-regional-hub-announces-four-facebook-community-impact-microgrants/) as recipients of the Facebook Community Impact Microgrant. Congratulations to The Shack Dwellers Federation of Namibia (social housing opportunities), OpenStreetMap Uganda (photo mapping with Mapillary), the Malawi OpenStreetMap community (refugee camp mapping), and the Center for Life Change and Development (mapping of facilities to fight gender-based violence).",13

14336,"WN569","Community","User dónal [published](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/d%C3%B3nal/diary/396923) a detailed diary entry about uploading dashcam imagery to Mapillary, with the hope of inspiring more mappers to experiment and document their experiences on this topic.",13

14321,"WN569","Software","This week Mapillary announced various changes to their service which include but are not limited to changes in the login process: Google, Facebook and OSM logins are going to be discontinued in favour of e-mail logins and a few website features such as the sequence editor (aside from blur editing) and web uploader will no longer be available. Android users will be required to download a [new app](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.mapillary.app) for capturing images. On the upside, Mapillary is going to offer photo filtering based on their age, 3D scenes will be available to browse for all, and a new API has been [introduced](https://www.mapillary.com/developer/api-documentation). To see all the changes visit the [Mapillary blog](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2021/06/09/platform-updates-june.html).",13

14958,"WN587","Mapping","Mapillary's change from API version 3 to 4 has apparently resulted in changed photo IDs, which had been tagged in OSM on some objects with [`mapillary= `](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:mapillary). There is a discussion on the tagging mailing list about how to handle the tag in the future. Mateusz Konieczny [proposes](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/tagging/2021-October/062637.html) abolishing the tag if a changeover is not possible.",13

15021,"WN589","Imports","Kai Poppe [has outlined](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/User:Kmpoppe/Automated_Edits/Mapillary_Update), on the wiki, preparations for  an automated edit to update `mapillary` tags made obsolete by a software update (as we [reported](https://weeklyosm.eu/archives/14930#wn587_25739) earlier). The plan is to update all `mapillary` tags from the old 22-character form to the new  numeric IDs of version 4. The Wiki page will be used to track current statistics and any further plan of action.
There was also a [MapRoulette challenge](https://maproulette.org/browse/challenges/23278) that sought to clean up all the invalid values, but it is now complete.",13

15241,"WN595","Software","OsmAnd version 4.1 has been released for Android and iOS. The Android update [includes](https://osmand.net/blog/osmand-android-4-1-released) support for Android Auto, disables the Mapillary layer plugin by default, and adds app shortcuts – for example, to quickly start a recording to upload tracks to OSM. The iOS update [includes](https://osmand.net/blog/osmand-ios-4-1-released) improved loading of maps.",13

15838,WN612","Software","The Mapillary team is [conducting](https://www.facebook.com/survey/?oid=332522592184448) a two minute user survey (via Facebook), with an option to answer extended questions. The goal is to gather community opinions about satisfaction with the Mapillary apps and platform and to make plans for Mapillary to better fit user needs. Anyone who has used Mapillary is encouraged to share feedback.",13

column1: 16068,"WN618","Other Geo Things","Florian Lohoff [showed](https://f.zz.de/posts/202205171455.e-scooter_mapillary/) how he attached a camera to an electric scooter to record street-level imagery for Mapillary.",13

16262,"WN624","Events","Open Mapping Hubs from HOT (Asia-Pacific, Eastern and Southern Africa, and Western and Northern Africa) are going to conduct a [training webinar](https://twitter.com/openmapping_ap/status/1544933819337166848), with Meta (Mapillary, MapWithAI), on AI-assisted mapping on Friday 15 July.",13

16293,"WN625","Other Geo Things","alexkemp [noticed](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/alexkemp/diary/399529) that pictures uploaded to Mapillary cannot be downloaded via their site any more and links to pictures become invalid after some time. He is not happy about his discovery.",13

16413,"WN630","Did you know that…","... if you are using the Greasemonkey Addon for the Firefox browser, there's a powerful script that gives you multiple ease-of-use changes for openstreetmap.org? You will have direct access to Mapillary and KartaView links that point to the same map area and multiple tools from a sidebar such as OSMCha (for Changesets), OSM Deep History, and Nominatim (for other Objects), or a link to create an overpass history request when you’re looking at a note. Also, when you’re viewing your 'My Notes' page, you will have the option to filter only unresolved notes for a better overview. You can see the development process on [GitHub](https://github.com/OSM-de/osm-org-greasemonkey), or you can [install the script](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/OSM-de/osm-org-greasemonkey@master/osm-org-greasemonkey.user.js) directly into Greasemonkey.",13

16471,"WN632","Mapping","After [comparing](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/2hu4u/diary/399839) different 360° cameras, OSM user [2hu4u](http://hdyc.neis-one.org/?2hu4u) [came up](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/2hu4u/diary/399857) with a fairly low-budget option for 360° street level imagery that has led to satisfying [results](https://www.mapillary.com/app/?pKey=587706673006447&lat=-33.96670267000005&lng=151.1021013300001&z=17) for mapping.",13

16622,"WN636","Community","[Cartocité](https://cartocite.fr/) :FR-s: >>> [:EN-t:](https://cartocite-fr.translate.goog/?_x_tr_sl=auto&_x_tr_tl=EN), an OpenStreetMap consultancy agency based in France, is currently [conducting](https://twitter.com/stfmani/status/1572254467894157313) :FR-s: a street-level imagery survey around the commune of Lons-le-Saunier. The collected data will be uploaded on Mapillary to be used in OpenStreetMap.",13

17121,"WN650","Programming","richlv [linked](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/richlv/diary/400630) to his script that brings back Mapillary's vanished feature to create a GPX file from image sequences.",13

17406,"WN658","Mapping","Martijn van Exel has written two blog articles on how to capture and upload 360° imagery with Mapillary. The first covers capturing images while [walking](https://mvexel.prose.sh/20230223-capturing-360-with-mapillary) and the second [biking](https://mvexel.prose.sh/20230226-capturing-360-with-mapillary-2-bike).",13

17451,"WN659","Mapping","Martijn van Exel [found](https://mvexel.prose.sh/20230303-capturing-360-with-mapillary-3-front-side) that his 360° imagery became sharper, and more readable for OSM tagging purposes, if he mounted the camera sideways.",13

17578,"WN663","Mapping","Andres Gomez Casanova [reviewed](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/AngocA/diary/401275) :ES-s:>>>[:EN-t:](https://www-openstreetmap-org.translate.goog/user/AngocA/diary/401275?_x_tr_sl=auto&_x_tr_tl=EN) the different services and websites that are available to capture and store geo-referenced street-level photos in the world. Some of them, such as [Mapillary](https://www.mapillary.com/), [KartaView](https://kartaview.org/) and [Mapilio](https://mapilio.com/), allow the use of the images for OSM mapping.",13

18073,"WN678","Local chapter news","OpenStreetMap US, in partnership with Mapillary, will be [running](https://www.openstreetmap.us/news/2023/06/mapillary_camera_grant) a 360 degrees camera grant programme for OSM community members in the United States.",13

18103,"WN679","Community","Stéphane De Greef single-handedly captured all of Brussels in 360° street view imagery, covering 4,500 km by bike in two years. All of his 600,000 plus images are available on Mapillary. OpenStreetMap Belgium have [published](https://openstreetmap.be/en/2023/07/23/st%C3%A9phane-streetview-brussels.html) a post on their blog about Stéphane's project.",13

18157,"WN681","Software","The  _Mapscaping Podcast_ [interviewed](https://mapscaping.podbean.com/e/the-rapid-editor/) Ben Clark, from META, about their Rapid Editor, which facilitates the conflation of AI-generated data (buildings, roads, etc.) with
OSM data. Collaboration with partners such as [Mapillary](https://www.mapillary.com/) and [HOT](https://www.hotosm.org/) are also discussed.",13

18460,"WN690","Community","OpenStreetMap Belgium and Mapillary are [teaming](https://openstreetmap.be/en/2023/10/07/european-camera-grant.html) up to improve the availability of street-level imagery in the European Union.",13

19192,"WN707","Mapping","Inspired by Koreller's [edits](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Koreller/diary/402507) to Pyongyang and the recently updated imagery provided by both Mapillary and Esri, CactiStaccingCrane has [embarked](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/CactiStaccingCrane/diary/403445) on mapping the urban areas of Hanoi.",13

19375,"WN712","Community","Deus Figendi [called](https://t.me/OSM_de/110146) :DE-s: for more use of [Panoramax](https://lucaslongour.org/posts/2024-01-12-panoramax-userjs-for-openstreetmap/). Paul [explained](https://t.me/OSM_de/110149) :DE-s: Panoramax in a nutshell: 'Street pictures à la Kartaview/Mapillary, but technically like Mastodon'. Christian Quest [explained](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Vh87F5Zie6k) it in detail in a video from SotM Europe 2023.",13

19421,"WN713","Community","OSM France [called](https://community.openstreetmap.org/t/massive-mapillary-takeout-for-panoramax/110693) out to Mapillary users who would like their photos to be migrated to the libre street view alternative Panoramax, which is hosted by OSM France.",13

19449,"WN713","Software","Peter Kontschieder [announced](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2024/03/11/Mapillary-NeRF.html) the release of Neural Radiance Fields (NeRFs), a 3D space visualisation feature, on Mapillary. These visualisations are created using 2D images that have been uploaded to Mapillary.",13

19488,"WN715","OSM research","An article in _The International Archives of the Photogrammetry, Remote Sensing and Spatial Information Sciences_ from 2022 [discussed](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/361053306_COLLABORATIVE_MAPPING_STRATEGY_IN_SUPPORT_OF_SLUM_UPGRADING_THE_CASE_OF_BOGOTA) a collaborative mapping strategy developed for slum upgrading in Bogotá, Colombia, detailing the creation of a methodology for remote data collection in a South American informal settlement. It highlights the benefits of collaboration between different stakeholders, including local NGOs and international volunteers, using OpenStreetMap and Mapillary to map over 700 points of interest in a Bogotá slum, and highlights the potential of the methodology to be replicated in similar contexts to improve living conditions through detailed and accessible mapping.",13

19630,"WN717","OSM in the media","Anne-Karoline Distel has [completed](https://www.kilkennypeople.ie/news/kilkenny-city/1478457/volunteer-mapper-completes-an-ambitious-photo-survey-of-kilkenny-city-check-it-out.html) an extensive photographic survey of Kilkenny City, capturing 360° street-level imagery that is now available on Mapillary. This volunteer effort, supported by a European Camera Grant from Meta, aims to improve OpenStreetMap data by focusing on areas accessible to pedestrians and cyclists.",13

19651,"WN718","Community","Branko Kokanovic [shared](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Branko%20Kokanovic/diary/403952) a detailed guide to optimising the use of the Insta360 ONE RS 1-inch camera for capturing and uploading street-level imagery to Mapillary, including tips on camera handling, video splitting, and improving GPS tracking accuracy using software solutions such as Geoapify for map matching. The images can also be uploaded to [Panoramax](https://panoramax.fr/).",13

20024,"WN727","Software","The new Mapillary iOS app, called 'Mapillary 2.0', [features](https://forum.mapillary.com/t/introducing-the-all-new-mapillary-ios-app/7992) a complete redesign for improved usability, including a new home page, action cards for upload status, faster uploads and map filtering using OpenStreetMap data, making it easier for users to capture, and manage street-level imagery.",13

20170,"WN730","Community","Brazil Singh and his team have run a workshop, at Jahangirnagar University in Bangladesh, [providing](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Brazil%20Singh/diary/404640) practical and theoretical training in OpenStreetMap and Mapillary, engaging participants in hands-on mapping activities and discussions on geospatial technologies.",13

20258,"WN732","Mapping campaigns","OpenStreetMap Utah is using Mapillary images to [improve](https://osmutah.org/2024/07/mapillary-imagery-for-openstreetmap-in-utah/) the OpenStreetMap data in Utah. Martijn van Exel talked about the current coverage in [Salt Lake City](https://www.openstreetmap.org/relation/198770), the gaps in recent images, and how people can contribute by taking and uploading images using the [Mapillary app](https://www.mapillary.com/mobile-apps). OSM Utah offers tools like a GoPro MAX camera and hosts events to facilitate participation in this project.",13

20713,WN743","Programming","Tykayn has improved their Mapillary [export](https://forge.chapril.org/tykayn/mapillary_download) script to be able to retrieve Mapillary sequences from multiple users and import them into Panoramax in bulk.  They offered to do this for anyone who wanted it, and were able to rescue over 14 million photos.  Tykayn gave a [presentation](https://peertube.openstreetmap.fr/w/tHdpBPWq3TJb21wmVhCM6i)  :FR-s: >   [:EN-t:](https://peertube-openstreetmap-fr.translate.goog/w/tHdpBPWq3TJb21wmVhCM6i?_x_tr_sl=auto&_x_tr_tl=EN) explaining the implications and methods used at the State of the Map France.",13

column1: 20767,"WN744","Community","Negreheb [blogged](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Negreheb/diary/405306) about his project to capture 360° images of the city of Salzburg, Austria, for Mapillary and possibly for Panoramax.",13

20771,"WN745","Community","Jacopofar [shared](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/jacopofar/diary/405409) his experience of contributing 360° imagery to Mapillary using a GoPro MAX, describing its benefits for capturing detailed street views, particularly in Milan, Italy, and detailing the camera setup, recording insights, and tips for improving coverage on OpenStreetMap.",13

20843,"WN746","OSM in the media","Anne-Karoline Distel corrected a speed limit discrepancy on Kilkenny's Bennettsbridge Road (Ireland) using OpenStreetMap, Mapillary, and field data collection. She updated the map to reflect accurate speed signs and thereby [promoted](https://www.kilkennypeople.ie/news/motoring/1642145/brilliant-speed-limit-anomaly-on-kilkenny-road-is-solved-by-mapper.html) OpenStreetMap as a reliable tool for local navigation updates.",13

20945,"WN748","Mapping","Detroit has become the most comprehensively mapped city on Mapillary, [achieving](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2024/11/18/detroit-the-most-covered-city-on-mapillary) 99.8% street coverage through a pioneering street-level imagery (SLI) programme launched in 2018 to address asset management challenges, [improving](https://detroitmi.gov/DetroitStreetView) city planning and even addressing census undercounts, demonstrating the transformative power of open SLI platforms in municipal operations.",13

21084,"WN751","Software","TrickyFoxy has [updated](https://en.osm.town/@foxy/113633788148829766) their script [better-osm-org](https://github.com/deevroman/better-osm-org/), adding a dark mode for iD, improving the changeset view mode by adding an edit war detector, searching for changesets by hashtags, and making values of `panoramax=` and `mapillary=` tags clickable. A detailed list of changes can be [found](https://community.openstreetmap.org/t/better-osm-org-a-script-that-adds-useful-little-things-to-osm-org/121670/8) on the OSM Community forum.",13

21319,"WN756","Community","OpenStreetMap Utah's 2024 review [highlighted](https://osmutah.org/2025/01/openstreetmap-utah-2024-year-in-review/) a productive year with 11,246 km of new pavements, 3,115 km of new roads, and 67,998 newly mapped buildings. Key achievements [included](https://en.osm.town/@mvexel/113800762179781395) 800 km of new hiking trails and the addition of 34,959 natural features. The community utilised tools including Rapid and Mapillary to enhance pedestrian and outdoor infrastructure, while also supporting updates to local points of interest. The efforts were bolstered by collaborations with OpenStreetMap US and the Trails Stewardship Initiative, making 2024 a milestone year for mapping Utah.",13

21281,"WN756","Other Geo Things","Christopher Beddow has [looked](https://worldbuilder.substack.com/p/street-view-a-history) at how street-level imagery has changed over time. He started by investigating the early 20th century with city recordings and goes on to discuss Google Street View and similar services today. He talked about important moments including the Aspen Movie Map (1978), early road surveys, and the CityBlock project at Stanford. This project was the first step in creating street view and similar services. Now there are other options such as  Mapillary and Panoramax, which use open-source and crowdsourcing methods. With new developments in computer vision and LiDAR, we can expect even more realistic 3D maps and experiences that we may be able to view on more than just our phones and computers.",13

21362,"WN758","Mapping campaigns","Negreheb [shared](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Negreheb/diary/406030) the progress being made on capturing Salzburg’s streets with 360° imagery for Mapillary and Panoramax. Challenges with route planning tools led to using OsmAnd for real-time GPX tracking and flexibility. They highlighted improvements using CLI tools for image uploads, ensuring efficiency and quality. Inspired by Detroit’s street coverage success, they aim to map all streets in Salzburg to improve OpenStreetMap and accessibility.",13

21448,"WN760","Maps","^\[1\]^ -karlos- (aka DerKarlos) has [revived](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/-karlos-/diary/406090) his old 3D-rendered OpenStreetMap project 'OSM go' by integrating Panoramax images after Mapillary's API shutdown, and is now exploring other improvements, including better 3D rendering techniques and possibly rewriting the project in Rust or Zig. You can [view](https://osmgo.org/go.html?km=1&lat=52.516275&lon=13.377232&ele=18.15&dir=-100&view=-19) the [Brandenburg Gate](https://www.openstreetmap.org/way/518071791), one of Germany's most famous [landmarks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brandenburg_Gate). There is an 'OSM go' project page on the OSM [wiki](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/OSM_go) and at [GitLab](https://gitlab.com/DerKarlos/osmgo).",13

21564,"WN763","Releases","TrickyFoxy has [published](https://community.openstreetmap.org/t/better-osm-org-a-script-that-adds-useful-little-things-to-osm-org/121670/57) better-osm-org 0.9, which includes: the display of satellite images in Chrome-based browsers, displaying photos from Mapillary, visualisation of `direction= `, display of the number of comments near links to changesets, and the ability to open objects in a changeset in JOSM or Level0.",13

21586,"WN764","Community","Bob Cameron has given us an [update](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/bob3bob3/diary/406304) on his detailed hardware configurations for capturing street views from his camper's windows using old phones and laptops, sharing his preferred mapping techniques for capturing images and uploading them to Mapillary.",13

21649,"WN765","Software","HeiGIT [reported](https://heigit.org/crowdmapping-on-street-level-imagery-with-mapswipe/) that [MapSwipe](https://mapswipe.org/en/), an open-source mobile and web app that enables volunteers to map missing geodata, now includes street-level imagery from [Mapillary](https://www.mapillary.com/). This new feature allows users to to identify new objects and enrich existing ones with valuable attributes.",13

21701,"WN766","Community","The Latin American and Caribbean Open Mapping Hub [held](https://www.hotosm.org/updates/cultivando-el-conocimiento-abierto-taller-de-mapeo-colaborativo-para-docentes-del-tec-de-monterrey/) :ES-s:>>>[:EN-t:](https://www-hotosm-org.translate.goog/updates/cultivando-el-conocimiento-abierto-taller-de-mapeo-colaborativo-para-docentes-del-tec-de-monterrey/?_x_tr_sl=es&_x_tr_tl=en) a workshop on OpenStreetMap and tools such as Mapillary, Organic Maps, and uMap for faculty members at Tecnológico de Monterrey, Mexico.
